## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an "x" -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project (PEP 8)
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My code passes all linting checks (`ruff check .`)
- [ ] My code is properly formatted (`ruff format .`)
- [ ] Type hints are added where appropriate
- [ ] I have added docstrings to new functions/classes

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested edge cases
- [ ] Test coverage has not decreased

### Documentation

- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] I have updated the README.md (if needed)
- [ ] I have updated API documentation (if endpoints changed)
- [ ] I have added/updated docstrings
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md

### Database Changes (if applicable)

- [ ] I have created/updated database migrations
- [ ] Migration can be rolled back successfully
- [ ] I have tested the migration on a clean database
- [ ] Schema changes are documented

### Security

- [ ] My changes don't introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] Sensitive data is not exposed in logs or responses
- [ ] Authentication/authorization is properly implemented
- [ ] Input validation is in place

### Dependencies

- [ ] I have added necessary dependencies using `uv add`
- [ ] I have updated `pyproject.toml` if needed
- [ ] Dependencies are pinned to specific versions
- [ ] New dependencies are necessary and justified

### Breaking Changes

<!-- If this PR introduces breaking changes, list them here -->

- [ ] This PR does not introduce breaking changes

## Reviewer Guidelines

**For reviewers, please check:**

- [ ] Code quality and style compliance
- [ ] Test coverage is adequate
- [ ] Documentation is clear and complete
- [ ] No security concerns
- [ ] Performance implications considered
- [ ] Error handling is appropriate
- [ ] Logging is meaningful
